title: Planning
text:
Motivate for a course in data visualization.

What do students get out of it?
How does the department benefit?






I like the idea of using gpt-3 for making preview images.
I will use a consistent prompt to get images in a similar style.
I will settle on one, but let’s try and find some good ideas in the meantime.
“a still-life painting of [theme] in the style of Paul Cézanne, hyper realistic, beautiful, ArtStation trending”

title: 00-Introduction
section: Quarto
text:
Quarto
Quarto enables you to weave together content and executable code into a finished presentation. To learn more about Quarto presentations see https://quarto.org/docs/presentations/.

title: 00-Introduction
section: Bullets
text:
Bullets
When you click the Render button a document will be generated that includes:

Content authored with markdown
Output from executable code

title: 00-Introduction
section: Code
text:
Code
When you click the Render button a presentation will be generated that includes both content and the output of embedded code. You can embed code like this:

title: 01 Aesthetic mappings
section: Sun hours mapped onto y position
text: Sun hours mapped onto y position

title: 01 Aesthetic mappings
section: Sun hours mapped onto colour
text: Sun hours mapped onto colour

title: 01 Aesthetic mappings
section: We define the mapping with aes()
text:
We define the mapping with aes()

ggplot(
  data = sun_hours,
  mapping = aes(x = date, y = sun_hours, colour = city)
) + geom_line(size = 2)

title: 01 Aesthetic mappings
section: We define the mapping with aes()
text:
We define the mapping with aes()

ggplot(
  data = sun_hours,
  mapping = aes(x = date, y = city, colour = sun_hours)
) + geom_point(size = 5)

title: 01 Aesthetic mappings
section: We frequently omit argument names
text:
We frequently omit argument names

Long form, all arguments are named:

ggplot(
  data = sun_hours,
  mapping = aes(x = date, y = city, colour = sun_hours)
) + geom_point(size = 5)


Abbreviated form, common arguments remain unnamed:

ggplot(sun_hours, aes(x = date, y = city, colour = sun_hours)) + 
  geom_point(size = 5)

title: 01 Aesthetic mappings
section: The geom determines how the data is shown
text:
The geom determines how the data is shown

ggplot(sun_hours, aes(date, sun_hours, colour = city)) + 
  geom_line(size = 2)

title: 01 Aesthetic mappings
section: The geom determines how the data is shown
text:
The geom determines how the data is shown

ggplot(sun_hours, aes(date, city, colour = sun_hours)) + 
  geom_point(size = 5)

title: 01 Aesthetic mappings
section: The geom determines how the data is shown
text:
The geom determines how the data is shown

ggplot(sun_hours, aes(month, sun_hours, colour = city)) + 
  geom_boxplot()

title: 01 Aesthetic mappings
section: The geom determines how the data is shown
text:
The geom determines how the data is shown

ggplot(sun_hours, aes(month, sun_hours, fill = city)) + 
  geom_violin() +
  facet_wrap(vars(city))

title: 01 Aesthetic mappings
section: colour and fill apply to different elements
text:
colour and fill apply to different elements


colour applies colour to points, lines, text, borders
fill applies colour to any filled areas

title: 01 Aesthetic mappings
section: Many geoms have both colour and fill aesthetics
text:
Many geoms have both colour and fill aesthetics

ggplot(sun_hours, aes(month, sun_hours, colour = city)) + 
  geom_boxplot()

title: 01 Aesthetic mappings
section: Many geoms have both colour and fill aesthetics
text:
Many geoms have both colour and fill aesthetics

ggplot(sun_hours, aes(month, sun_hours, fill = city)) + 
  geom_boxplot()

title: 01 Aesthetic mappings
section: Many geoms have both colour and fill aesthetics
text:
Many geoms have both colour and fill aesthetics

ggplot(sun_hours, aes(month, sun_hours, colour = city, fill = city)) + 
  geom_boxplot()

title: 01 Aesthetic mappings
section: Aesthetics can also be used as parameters in geoms
text:
Aesthetics can also be used as parameters in geoms

ggplot(sun_hours, aes(month, sun_hours, fill = city)) + 
  geom_boxplot(colour = "midnightblue")

title: 01 Aesthetic mappings
section: Aesthetics can also be used as parameters in geoms
text:
Aesthetics can also be used as parameters in geoms

ggplot(sun_hours, aes(month, sun_hours, colour = city)) + 
  geom_boxplot(fill = "midnightblue")

text:
